lead_paragraph: REED--Howard, 90, of Wellington, Florida, died peacefully with his family in Dresher, Pennsylvania on January 21, 2016. Howard was a devoted and loving husband for 66 years to his beautiful wife, Dolores, who died just 23 days before, and a loving father to his children, Janet and Rob, their spouses Dan and Julie, and his grandchildren, Lindsay, Ben, and Michael. Howard was born in 1925 in Brooklyn, NY. At 17, he became a radio broadcaster for WBAX and later at WNYC, where at 19, he broadcast General Eisenhower's triumphant ticker-tape parade down 5th Avenue. When he enlisted in the Army/Air Force, he became a broadcaster for Armed Forces Radio in Berlin. Howard entered the publishing field in his 20's, and was the publisher for more than 50 magazines in a career that spanned over 50 years in New York and Stamford in fields as diverse as electronics, entertainment, floor covering, and education. A gifted speaker and storyteller, after his retirement from publishing, Howard was a regular lecturer for Palm Beach College on politics, economics, and the media. Funeral services will be held on Tuesday, January 26th at 11:00am at the Plaza Jewish Community Chapel at 630 Amsterdam Avenue, in Manhattan. Following the services, Howard will be buried next to Dolores at the Beth David Cemetery, 300 Elmont Road, Elmont, NY. 1/3
